article: When I was a small boy my family was very poor. My father always used his savings to _ my mother to visit her parents who lived far away. There was just my younger brother and myself in the house. One evening Dad came home from _ and there was no food in the house, not _ a piece of bread. Although we were _ , my brother and I went to bed without eating anything. My father had no money, but I knew from the _ on his face that he could not let us have an empty stomach. He _ the house and about two hours later returned and quickly _ us up. He had in his hand two small potato pies, which he gave us to eat. I don't know where he got the _ but somehow he _ to get us something to eat. My father had not eaten and had worked all day _ he sat there with great satisfaction watching us eat. This has _ stayed in my mind and left more of an impression than any amount of _ he may ever have given me. At that moment, I felt happy knowing that he was there and would not let us _ . I guess the _ I am trying to make is that in difficult times it is _ not to show weakness but strength and character. If a _ is the cement that holds a family together, then the father is _ that strengthens that cement. It is his values and _ and memories that have carried me forward and helped me to work out my own problems in life. In my own _ I have learned that it is the valuable time you spend with your children and the values you give to them that will remain with them always.
